admin.name: Admin Login
admin.description: Give correct Mobile no. and passsword and get $adminkey for admin.

headers: Make sure that to use JSON headers.
body: Use correct admin mobile no. and password in place of $mobile and $password

success.description: Success response is returned when Mobile and Password are correct.

error 1.description: This response is returned if any one of 'mobile' or 'password' is missing.

error 2.description: This response is returned when Mobile and password are incorrect

admin.name: Create users
admin.description: Create new user with Mobile no. and password.

headers: Make sure that to use JSON headers. Also, use the $adminkey previously stored from 'Admin Login' response
body: Use new mobile no. and password in place of $mobile and $password for the user you want to create

success.description: This response is returned when user is created without issue.

error 1.description: This response is returned when the mobile no. provided already exist in database.

user.name: User Login
user.description: Give correct Mobile no. and passsword and get $authkey.

headers: Make sure that to use JSON headers.
body: Use correct user mobile no. and password in place of $mobile and $password

success.description: This response is returned when Mobile and Password are correct.

error 1.description: This response is returned when Mobile and password are incorrect

error 2.description: This response is returned when Mobile no. is not 10 digits long

user.name: User authkey check
user.description: Check if the authkey is valid. This is used to auto login.

headers: Make sure that to use JSON headers. Also, use the $authkey previously stored from 'User Login' response

success.description: This response is returned when $authkey is valid.
success.tip: skip the login page if you get this repsonse.

error.description: This response is returned when $authkey is invalid.

user.name: Create New Entry
user.description: Used to create new entry in the database. This entry is specific to user's mobile no.

headers: Make sure that to use JSON headers. Also, use the $authkey previously stored from 'User Login' response
body: Use appropriate values for $amount and $description, $type can either be 'credit' or 'debit'

success.description: This response is returned when the entry is created.
success.tip: Refresh the page or load updated data after this.

error 1.description: This response is returned when $authkey is invalid.

error 2.description: This response is returned if any one of 'amount', 'description' or 'type' is missing.

user.name: Get All Entries
user.description: Used to get all entries for the user as an array of objects. These entries are specific to user's mobile no.

headers: Use the $authkey previously stored from 'User Login' response

success.description: These response is returned when $authkey is valid. The entries are saved as array in 'entry' key. The array can be empty if there are no entries or contain multiple objects.
success.tip: may need to loop over 'entry' values

error.description: This response is returned when $authkey is invalid.

user.name: Edit An Entry
user.description: Used to edit an entry using it's 'id'

headers: Use the $authkey previously stored from 'User Login' response
body: $id is recieved from the response of 'Get All Entries'.

success.description: These response is returned when entry is updated successfully.
success.tip: Refresh the page or load updated data after this.

error 1.description: This response is returned when $authkey is invalid.

error 2.description: This response is returned if any one of 'id', 'amount', 'description' or 'type' is missing.

user.name: Delete Entry
user.description: Used to detete a specific entry by 'id'. the entry you want to delete must specific to user's mobile no.

headers: Use the $authkey previously stored from 'User Login' response
query: $id is the id of the entry you want to delete. This id is recieved from the response of 'Get All Entries'.

success.description: This response is returned when the entry 'id' you provided in query is deleted.
success.tip: Refresh the page or load updated data after this.

error 1.description: This response is returned when $authkey is invalid.

error 2.description: This response is returned when the $id you provided is already deleted or is invalid
